full_text: Screened by NARA, 8/11/2023 8. CONTINUALION OF COVERAGE Other A. COVERAGE AFTER 19 Contract Provisions We will cover your unmarried dependent child under your family contract only until his or her 19th birthday. If he or she wants to continue membership, without any lapse in coverage, a completed application must be sent to us within 72 days of the 19th birthday. Your child will then be given an individual contract and will be billed accordingly. (continued) B. MARRIAGE BEFORE 19 If your dependent child marries before reaching age 19, we will cover him or her only until the date of marriage. He or she may enroll in a family contract to continue membership if we are notified within 72 days of the date of marriage. C. HANDICAPPED CHILD AFTER 19 If your dependent child is either mentally or physically handicapped upon reaching 19 years of age and not capable of earning his or her own living, special arrangements can be made for your child to continue coverage under your family contract. You must apply for this continued coverage within 72 days of your child's 19th birthday. In addition, you must supply us with any medical or other information that we may need to determine if your child is eligible to continue coverage under your family contract. D. OFFSPRING OF A DEPENDENT CHILD Whenever your dependent child's coverage under your family contract ends, the coverage for any offspring of that dependent child also ends. A new contract can be obtained by application to us within 72 days of the dependent child's date of marriage or 19th birthday. E. COVERAGE AFTER DIVORCE If the subscriber is divorced, but not remarried, the former spouse may continue membership under an existing family contract when the subscriber is legally obligated to provide health insurance coverage. This coverage is only valid until either the subscriber or the former spouse remarries. The former spouse must send us a completed application within 72 days following remarriage if he or she wishes to continue coverage under a separate contract. F. COVERAGE AFTER 65 We will cover you under this contract until the 1st day of the month in which you turn 65 years of age and become eligible for Part A (Hospital Insurance) and Part B (Medical Insurance) of Medicare. However, you can then enroll in any supplemental MEDEX contract that is offered. if you notify us within 90 days of your Medicare effective date. In the above cases, if coverage under this contract ends we will continue to provide benefits ONLY if you are receiving covered inpatient care on your cancellation date and ONLY for services in connection with that inpatient stay. We will provide you with these benefits until you use them up or are discharged. whichever comes first. Page 15 9. TERMINATION OF A CONTRACT V CANCTI YOUR CONTRACT
